snippet: President Obama met with top Republican senators on Tuesday about nominating a successor to Justice Antonin Scalia, but the G.O.P. side was unyielding
abstract: Number of Republican Senators join Vice Pres Joseph R Biden Jr and Pres Obama in Oval Office in meeting called by president to discuss process of choosing nominee to succeed late Supreme Court Justice Antonin Scalia; Senate Minority Leader Harry Reid describes meeting as unproductive and reports Republicans appear to have no intentions of working toward choosing nominee in election year.

byline.original: By GARDINER HARRIS and DAVID M. HERSZENHORN

lead_paragraph: President Obama met with top Republican senators on Tuesday about nominating a successor to Justice Antonin Scalia, but the G.O.P. side was unyielding

headline.main: Obama and G.O.P. Senators Meet on Filling Scalia’s Seat, to No Avail
headline.print_headline: Obama and G.O.P. Senators Meet on Filling Scalia’s Seat, to No Avail
